classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, C2, C3, C4, C1-C5 elective, D1, D2, D3, D4, and D5. C4 and D5 should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D1, D3, D4, or D5.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
Select one of the following: ERSC476/NR476, ERSC477/NR477, ERSC478/NR478, ERSC479/NR479.

Select from the following: BRAE236, BRAE340, BRAE345, BRAE435, BRAE532; ERSC303, ERSC323; GEOL241; NR260, NR315, NR339, NR418, NR475; NR/BIO/SS 421; NR/CRP 408; PHYS107; SS431, SS432; STAT313.

If a course is taken to meet a major requirement, it cannot be double-counted as an approved elective for the concentration. Consultation with advisor is recommended prior to selecting approved electives; bear in mind your selections may impact pursuit of post-baccalaureate studies and/or goals.
